title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death. The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" introduces a new provision for the termination of monthly insurance benefits upon death, specifying the calculation and payment process for benefits in the event of an individual's death within the first 15 days of a month. Additionally, amendments are made to Section 223 of the Social Security Act regarding the termination of disability insurance benefits upon death. The provision outlines the calculation and payment process for monthly insurance benefits upon an individual's death within the first 15 days of a month. The benefit amount is reduced to 50% and rounded up to the next dollar. Payment is made in accordance with section 204(d). The provision specifies that if an individual dies within the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount rounded up to the next dollar. Payment will be made according to section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. Amendments are made to sections 202(a) and 202(b)(1) regarding the payment of benefits for the month of the recipient's death. Amendments are made to sections 202(b)(1) and 202(c)(1) of the Social Security Act regarding the payment of benefits for the month of the recipient's death. Amendments are made to sections 202(d)(1) and 202(e)(1) of the Social Security Act regarding child's and widow's insurance benefits, respectively. Amendments are made to sections 202(f)(1) and 202(g)(1) of the Social Security Act regarding widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits. Amendments are made to sections 202(f)(1) and 202(g)(1) of the Social Security Act regarding widower's, mother's, and father's insurance benefits. Changes include adjustments to when benefits end upon remarriage or death. Amendments to the Social Security Act include changes to benefits for uninsured individuals at age 72 and an exemption from the maximum benefit cap. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for individuals receiving benefits under certain sections upon death. Increase in lump-sum death payments. Section 202(i) of the Social Security Act is amended to specify the applicable dollar amount for lump-sum death payments. The Commissioner of Social Security determines and publishes the dollar amount for each calendar year. The product for lump-sum death payments is calculated by multiplying $955 by the ratio of the national average wage index for the year before the determination to the index for 2001. If the result is not a multiple of $5.00, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of $5.00. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
